image.altText: Fire crews stand in front of an overturned bus beside a road.

items.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says the "mental scars will not go away" for those involved in a fatal bus crash after a wedding at Wandin Valley Estate. Follow live.

title.children: Bus driver in 'charging process', police say, after crash kills 10 wedding guests

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: NSW Health has just sent through a patient update. As of 2pm, they had 15 passengers remaining in their care: One patient is in a critical, but stable condition Eight patients are in a stable  condition at John Hunter Hospital, including two patients who were transferred  from Maitland Hospital Three patients are in a stable condition at Maitland Hospital One patient is in a stable condition at Calvary Mater Newcastle. Two patients are in a stable condition at Royal Prince Alfred Hospital
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 15 passengers remain in hospital

props.alt: The John Hunter Hospital emergency entrance.

children.content: NSW Health has just sent through a patient update.
As of 2pm, they had 15 passengers remaining in their care:
One patient is in a critical, but stable condition
Eight patients are in a stable  condition at John Hunter Hospital, including two patients who were transferred  from Maitland Hospital
Three patients are in a stable condition at Maitland Hospital
One patient is in a stable condition at Calvary Mater Newcastle.
Two patients are in a stable condition at Royal Prince Alfred Hospital

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: NSW Police Commissioner Karen Webb is speaking now. She says she can't imagine what the families must be feeling. She says there's a long process ahead. The driver is still yet to be charged. "He is currently in the charging process," she says. She says rescue officers remain at the scene recovering those who died.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Police are giving an update

children.content: NSW Police Commissioner Karen Webb is speaking now.
She says she can't imagine what the families must be feeling.
She says there's a long process ahead.
The driver is still yet to be charged.
"He is currently in the charging process," she says.
She says rescue officers remain at the scene recovering those who died.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Acting Assistant Commissioner Tracy Chapman says police have begun taking witness statements from survivors. "They're witnesses to what occurred last night, they're providing a version of, or witness statement in terms of what they experienced and that will assist us with our inquiries and furthering that investigation," she says.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Survivors have begun speaking with police

children.content: Acting Assistant Commissioner Tracy Chapman says police have begun taking witness statements from survivors.

"They're witnesses to what occurred last night, they're providing a version of, or witness statement in terms of what they experienced and that will assist us with our inquiries and furthering that investigation," she says.

image.altText: An overhead shot of a bus on its side.

items.synopsis: Forensic and traffic police are piecing together the events of a fatal bus crash in NSW's Hunter Valley, which has claimed the lives of at least 10 wedding-goers.

title.children: What we know about how a bus carrying more than 30 wedding guests crashed in the NSW Hunter

image.altText: A person's hands are illuminated by the pale glow of a computer screen, as they type in a dark room.

items.synopsis: The newest victims of a notorious Russian ransomware gang say they have been terrified by the latest cyber attack on an Australian bond broker that has billions of dollars under advice.

title.children: 'You have 3 days': Russian criminals post screenshots of passports to dark web after bond broker data breach

image.altText: Woman toasting champagne at a wedding.

items.synopsis: A speech pathologist who has not been seen since the small boat she was travelling in capsized has been described as a tireless community worker.

title.children: Family heartbroken as search suspended for grandmother lost at sea

image.altText: a close up shot of annastacia palaszczuk wearing a cream jacket and pearl earrings

items.synopsis: Queensland Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk says her government will pull "every lever possible" to ensure Queenslanders had a roof over their heads, committing millions in tomorrow's state budget.

title.children: 'We are throwing everything at this': Palaszczuk reveals new details of $320m housing package

image.altText: Three flight attendants on an empty plane posing in aisle and behind seats

items.synopsis: The airline is scrapping its gender-based uniform guidelines — and it's not the first, with many airlines having updated their rules to allow staff to show their authentic selves.

title.children: Qantas to allow flat shoes, make-up and long hair on crew of any gender — but what does this mean for inclusivity?

image.altText: smiling woman with two smiling young  boys

items.synopsis: Jacqueline Morton has four sustainable tiny homes on her 32-acre property, but the local council is kicking out the vulnerable residents living on her land.

title.children: Property owner blasts 'disgusting attitude' of Sunshine Coast Council as it evicts her tiny home residents

image.altText: Headshots of a smiling man in a cap wearing glasses, and a woman wearing sunglasses

items.synopsis: A 23-year-old man who allegedly ran over and killed WA police officer Anthony Woods in Perth is set to be charged with his murder, as the constable's family remember him as "a devoted husband and loving son".

title.children: Police to lay upgraded murder charge over WA officer's death as 'shattered' family leads tributes

image.altText: Daniel Lees wears a grey t-shirt in front of a home's front door.

items.synopsis: Daniel Lees's home ownership dreams were shattered after a Gold Coast developer ripped up his vacant land contract without his consent and then offered to sell it back to him for $200,000 more. In Queensland, this is legal.

title.children: Daniel had a contract with a developer. One decision left him priced out of the housing market

image.altText: Image of a customer using a tap-and-go credit card in a store.

items.synopsis: Business owners who have stopped accepting cash say it speeds up service and improves safety and security for staff, but some customers say it is their right to pay cash.

title.children: No law exists to stop businesses from refusing cash. Why do some people care so much?

image.altText: A young man runs away from the camera on a football field at night kicking a soccer ball. He is wearing a team uniform.

items.synopsis: Australian soccer's governing body is taking a cut from every local bet placed on games at all levels, including amateur suburban competitions.

title.children: 'It's disturbing': This suburban football club had no idea international gamblers could place bets on their games

image.altText: A group of soldiers and small frail children covered in blankets on the jungle floor

items.synopsis: The eldest child of the four siblings told her family their mother was alive for four days before she died from injuries in plane crash.

title.children: Children from Amazon plane crash share story of survival with family

image.altText: Donald Trump in blue suit and red tie speaking at podium with US flag in the background.

items.synopsis: Former US attorney-general William Barr says Donald Trump is "toast" if allegations that he wilfully retained hundreds of highly classified documents are proven true under Special Counsel Jack Smith's 37-count indictment against the former president.

title.children: Donald Trump's former attorney-general says 'he's toast' if indictment allegations are true

image.altText: Bus In Day Still Down

items.synopsis: Ten people have died and multiple others have been injured in a bus crash in the NSW Hunter Valley, with emergency services called to Wine Country Drive at Greta just after 11.30pm on Sunday.

title.children: Driver arrested, in the process of being charged after 10 people killed in Hunter Valley wedding bus crash

image.altText: Xavier Coates, wearing his Queensland State of Origin guernsey and a mouth guard, looks to the sky.

items.synopsis: Queensland coach Billy Slater has made three changes to the side who claimed victory in State of Origin I as the Maroons look to wrap up the series on home soil.

title.children: Injury-plagued Queensland recall three players for State of Origin II

image.altText: A drone shot of large oil tanks and processing facilities.

items.synopsis: Thevenard Island was once a lucrative oil field, but the Pilbara tourism sector hopes it can become a tourism hotspot.

title.children: Can this abandoned oil field be transformed in to a must-see holiday destination?

image.altText: Young man in a blue and gold polo shirt sitting in a wheelchair, smiles, glasses, curly hair, brick wall and shrubs behind.

items.synopsis: A former WA Para-athlete of the Year, Cory Crombie has admitted the offences in the Bunbury Magistrates Court.

title.children: Disability advocate and para-athlete pleads guilty to possessing child abuse material

image.altText: Toby Price and Jason Duncan win the car category of the Finke Desert Race

items.synopsis: Motorsport legend Toby Price says it's a "dream come true" winning his ninth King of the Desert car title at the Finke Desert Race, as David Walsh storms home to take out the bike section for the fourth time.

title.children: Toby Price wins record ninth King of the Desert title at Finke Desert Race

image.altText: A bearded man in a baseball cap

items.synopsis: Richmond player Marlion Pickett is granted bail after allegedly carrying out burglaries on commercial properties in which more than $380,000 was stolen.

title.children: Details revealed of Marlion Pickett's alleged involvement in theft of $380k from commercial premises as bail granted

image.altText: A blurred image from high of a crowd of people.

items.synopsis: A lack of data on how consumers are responding to monetary policy could lead the Reserve Bank to raise rates into a recession. And what if that's difficult to escape? It's a critical economic question right now, writes David Taylor.

title.children: The economy is in a race to the bottom and nobody wants to win

image.altText: A man speaks into a megaphone surrounded by journalists outside in PNG

items.synopsis: Papua New Guinea's former prime minister, Peter O'Neill, is charged with giving false evidence after a commission of inquiry recommends he be prosecuted.

title.children: Former PNG Prime Minister Peter O'Neill charged with giving false evidence at inquiry

image.altText: The outline of four women, kept anonymous, superimposed over shattered glass

items.synopsis: The deaths of four Aboriginal women in the Northern Territory briefly captured headlines. But years after their deaths, the coroner is about to examine each of their tragic stories in depth.

title.children: Coroner examining deaths of four Aboriginal women warns evidence will be 'shocking'

image.altText: Indigenous Australians Minister Linda Burney standing on stage and speaking into a microphone.

items.synopsis: Political campaigning for an Indigenous Voice to Parliament takes centre stage at this year's Barunga Festival in the remote Northern Territory.

title.children: Calls for an Indigenous Voice dominate Barunga Festival on major anniversary

image.altText: A young, Caucasian man in a suit is pictured, with a blossomed tree with bright red leaves in the background.

items.synopsis: The Greens are trying to strike a deal with the federal government to ensure more social and affordable homes are built.

title.children: Greens offer another option on key housing legislation

image.altText: A group of Australian men's cricketers cheer for the camera as the captain holds a large golden mace.

items.synopsis: Seven weeks after their World Test Championship victory, Australia hope to be back at The Oval celebrating "legacy-defining stuff" as Ashes victors.

title.children: After the mace, we want legacy-defining Ashes urn, says triumphant captain Pat Cummins

image.altText: Composite image of Shellie Morris, Astrid Jorgenson, Tim Winton and Barry Humphries.

items.synopsis: Prominent Australians including author Tim Winton and late comedian Barry Humphries are appointed to the Order of Australia, in the first year women outnumber men on the honours list.

title.children: 'Life's great, I love it': The passionate Australians being honoured this King's Birthday

image.altText: Australian banknotes, mostly $50 bills, strewn over a flat surface.

items.synopsis: Almost 5 million Australians claimed work from home expenses last financial year, but the ATO has changed the methods you can use to claim tax deductions this tax time. Landlords renting out property and crypto investors are also under focus.

title.children: The ATO's changed the methods you can use to claim tax deductions for working from home

image.altText: A smiling, balding man a dark suit – Gold Coast Mayor Tom Tate – wearing a ceremonial medallion.

items.synopsis: Mayor Tom Tate says the increase will cost households about $4 extra per week.

title.children: Gold Coast residents hit with $200 rate rise in council budget

image.altText: A golfer is lifted in the air by his caddie on the 18th green after winning a tournament.

items.synopsis: Wild scenes in Toronto, as Canadian golfer Nick Taylor sinks the longest putt of his career on the fourth play-off hole to become his country's first player in 69 years to win the Canadian Open — watch the incredible finish, and what happened next, here.

title.children: Oh Canada! Nick Taylor sinks 22-metre monster putt to win PGA Tour playoff

image.altText: Photo of young woman with long hair, hat and backpack walking with beach, trees and Cairns Esplanade lagoon in the background

items.synopsis: Bailey Seamer has conquered much of her gruelling trek up Australia's east coast, checking into a mental health hospital twice along the way. She wants people like her to know they are "capable of achieving great things".

title.children: Bailey has checked into a mental health hospital twice during her 5,000km trek. But she's determined to finish
